intro: Actinodaphne maingayi var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic actinodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical-shaped leaves and aromatic bark, which are typical features of the Lauraceae family. It thrives in tropical rainforest environments, often growing as an understory plant. The fruit is a small, smooth, dark blue drupe that contains a single seed.
